comment: Professor Nava's class, while tough, can be very rewarding to those that care about doing well. She loves teaching and is very interested in the subject matter. She is very entertaining in class and makes the material enjoyable. Her tests are pretty tough and entirely based upon the notes, so take good notes! She often helps students who struggle.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She is hilarious and has so many fascinating and great stories to tell. She likes discussing issues with the class, too, so it's interactive. This is a professor who is super passionate about what she teaches. Attendance is mandatory and graded, but class is NEVER boring. Take good notes, and tests will be a breeze. You won't regret taking Nava!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Nava is absolutely amazing. She does a great job of teaching her material through stories. She is absolutely hilarious. If you show up to class you can easily pass the tests and quizzes, which are all online. She does give you a grade for attendance so it is important that you show up. Overall, this class is a fun and easy A

Dr. Nava has 15 years of criminal justice experience and is a GREAT professor. Our semester started recently and she cares a lot about your success and the accessibility of what she is teaching. Coming to class and listening is all it takes to get an A. If you want to take CRJU at KSU, take her, you will not regret it.

gives you 10mins for 10 questions on a quiz readings can be up to 30 pages long pop quiz questions are tiny details from the readings going to this class is almost useless beside the pop quizzes and SOMETIMES a good class discussion often makes you watch videos the whole time or lectures on the previous quizzes not the one youre going to take
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I dont understand how Professor Nava doesnt have a better rating. She is AMAZING & the class is very informative. The lectures are around 20 minutes & they can be a bit boring a times but VERY informative. She is very accessible & caring. If you dont get an A, you didnt try at all. Dont be thrown off by these fake news reviews! Take Professor Nava!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I genuinely loved this class. If you are interested in the topic. Yea you read a lot but the lectures get into pretty relevant topics about what goes on in the news. I would take this class again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: As long as you read, the class is super easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Okay, my class gave her SUCH a hard time. Although she was inconsistent with her grading, she did genuinely try to help us in any way she could without just handing us the grades. You definitely need the book and ASK QUESTIONS she will help you!!

She absolutely requires you to read. She is the toughest grader Ive ever encountered, but is willing to comment on your work if you send it to her before turning it in. Be prepared to teach yourself the and SPSS portions because she was awful.

Made a CRJU major out of me! Her lectures were so interesting! Her tests are super tough, but if you follow the rubric exactly for the two papers and actually read before you take the online quizzes it balances it out. I got a B because I didn't follow her rubric for the first paper. Powerpoint's give what she will test over. Bumped my 79.45 to a B
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--Tests are tough

comment: Very tough teacher. She will not work with you on anything. She is very firm and strictly goes by syllabus. She is the first teacher whom I have ever had that refuses to understand stuff happens and will not work with you. Her quizzes she gives you 10 mins to take a 10 min question quiz. Her test are timed and difficult. I do not recommend her.
She knows what is talking about. She has a great example of today and past incidents. Nice to learn.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Her tests are hard, and her quizzes can be stressful because they are timed. She has good stories, and at times can be funny. Everything is good other than the tests
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Best teacher I've had. Only two tests, midterm and final and she gives study guides. Reading due each week with 10 question. 10 min online quiz over the chapter. Not difficult because she reminds you she tests for the important stuff, things she would want you to know outside class. Only two papers as well. Just follow the rubrics. AWESOME STORIES.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: You do have to read the textbook. Quiz online for every chapter. 10 minutes to take each quiz 10 questions so you have to read the chapter and take notes. 2 tests, midterm and final. I studied the "study guide" and did well on both tests. 2 papers graded fairly. She is just basically looking for you to follow directions on the papers. Fun class!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She was pretty good, if you actually come to class and read the book before class you will be fine. Has a few papers, she dropped one of them. Her tests are really hard. Straight out of the book. She takes attendance every day, and did some pop quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Changed my major because of this professor. Her lectures are just fun facts, cool stories, and unique court cases HOWEVER her exams don't include any of this and reading the book only helps a little. Once I stopped going to class and just taught myself my exam scores improved. Not terrible, but wouldn't recommend for CRJU majors.
